summary: This is a sealed application and supporting affidavit from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, filed on June 29, 2020, seeking warrants and orders for prospective/historical location data and pen register information for two cellphones believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. The document reveals the government's efforts to locate and arrest Maxwell following her indictment on charges related to the sexual exploitation of minors with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation and the subject of a sealed indictment and arrest warrant for conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury related to Jeffrey Epstein's activities. The government believes she uses the two target cellphones.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a close associate and employer of Ghislaine Maxwell. His phone, seized during his July 2019 arrest, contained a contact for one of Maxwell's target phones under the name 'Ghislaine'.

persons.name: Joshua Perry
persons.role: Contact / Husband of former Epstein employee
persons.context: His phone was in contact with one of Maxwell's target phones as recently as May 2020. Identified as the husband of a former Epstein employee.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Her phone was in contact with both of Maxwell's target phones, with the last contact noted around August 2019.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney representing Maxwell in civil litigation. Her phone was in contact with both of Maxwell's target phones, with the last contact noted around August 2019.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Maxwell shares a joint bank account and to whom her Amazon account has sent packages. His phone was in contact with both of Maxwell's target phones, with the last contact noted around August 2019.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: Signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020.

persons.name: Catharine H. Parker
persons.context: The magistrate judge who swore the FBI agent's affidavit and issued the warrants and orders for the cellphone tracking on June 29, 2020.

persons.name: Amanda Youna
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent who authored and swore the affidavit in support of the warrants for cellphone location and pen register information.

connections.description: Described as a close associate and employee. Maxwell is charged with committing crimes together with Epstein.
Laura Menninger is identified as an attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation, and their phones were in contact.
Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister, and their phones were in contact.
Scott Borgerson is identified as an individual with whom Maxwell shares a joint bank account, indicating a close financial relationship.
Joshua Perry's phone was in contact with Maxwell's phone. He is the husband of a former Epstein employee.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed an arrest warrant the same day.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI on federal sex trafficking charges. An iPhone was seized from his possession during the arrest.

events.title: Court Orders for Cellphone Tracking
events.description: Magistrate Judge Catharine H. Parker issued sealed warrants and orders authorizing the government to obtain prospective/historical location data and pen register information for two cellphones linked to Ghislaine Maxwell for 45 days.

keyFacts: On June 29, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted and an arrest warrant was issued for her, but this information was not publicly known at the time of this sealed application.
The government sought to track two cellphones: one subscribed to 'Terramar Project, Inc.' (Maxwell's non-profit) and another subscribed to 'G Max', both believed to be used by Maxwell.
Evidence linking Maxwell to the phones includes a contact saved as 'Ghislaine' in Jeffrey Epstein's seized iPhone and recent calls to her sister, attorneys, and associates.
The application was sealed to prevent Maxwell from fleeing, intimidating witnesses, or destroying evidence, and service providers were ordered not to disclose the warrants.
The requested tracking included precise GPS location data, cell tower data, toll records, and pen register information for calls and texts.
